page.title: 05HOUSE NAMES IN GLADESTRY
page.content: In our village there are 42 houses; most of these have names not numbers.13 of the houses in the centre of the village have Welsh names and 25 have English names. Most of the houses with Welsh names are fairly new. More people seem to like Welsh names than they did years ago. The council houses are called Glanravon. This means Side of the river. Our Headmaster's new house is called Cil-y-Nant which means Bend in the stream. Another house is called 'Cartref'. This means 'Home' in Welsh. A lot of the English names tell where the house was or what it was used for.'Upper Shop'shows that there were once two shops.'The White Hart'was an inn. Two old houses with English names are 'Chough Cottage' and 'The Eyrie'. These have been named by people from the outside who have came to live in Gladestry.
